Yes, I'd be happy to recommend some low-impact exercises that are effective and safe for someone with a knee injury:

1. Swimming and Water Aerobics: Swimming and water aerobics can be excellent low-impact exercises that are easy on the knees. The water helps reduce the impact on the joints while still providing a great workout.

2. Cycling: Cycling can be a great low-impact exercise that can be done indoors or outdoors. You can use a stationary bike or a low-resistance setting on a regular bike.

3. Pilates: Pilates exercises can be an effective way to strengthen and stretch muscles, build core strength, and improve flexibility without putting too much strain on the knees.

4. Yoga: Yoga can also be an excellent low-impact exercise that can help strengthen muscles, improve balance, flexibility, and reduce stress. However, be sure to avoid any poses that cause discomfort or pain to your knee.

5. Elliptical: An elliptical machine is an excellent low-impact exercise that mimics running without the high impact on your joints. An elliptical can provide a great cardiovascular workout, and you can adjust the resistance to make the exercise more or less intense.

Remember to always listen to your body and avoid any exercises that cause pain or discomfort to your knee. If you have any doubts or concerns, it's always best to consult with a healthcare professional or physical therapist to determine the most appropriate exercises for your specific knee injury.
